Goldsmith}} '''Joel Goldsmith''' (November 19, 1957 – April 29, 2012<ref name="Obit">{{cite web | last=Burlingame | first=Jon | work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] | title=Composer Joel Goldsmith dies at 54|date=April 30, 2012 | url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118053333?refCatId=16 | accessdate=April 30, 2012}}</ref>) was a [[composer]] of [[film]], [[television]], and [[video game]] [[music]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.airlockalpha.com/node/9105/stargate-composer-joel-goldsmith-dies-at-54.html |title=Stargate Composer Joel Goldsmith Dies At 54 | last=Hinman | first=Michael |publisher=Airlock Alpha |date=April 30, 2012 |accessdate=April 30, 2012}}</ref> == Biography == Joel Goldsmith was born on November 19, 1957 in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], the third of four children of Sharon ([[Married and maiden names|née]] Hennagin), a singer,<ref>[http://books.google.ca/books?id=uYoYAAAAIAAJ&q=Sharon+Hennagin+Goldsmith&dq=Sharon+Hennagin+Goldsmith&hl=en&redir_esc=y]</ref> and renowned composer [[Jerry Goldsmith]]. His mother's brother was composer and professor [[Michael Hennagin]].<ref>[http://books.google.ca/books?id=jVgJAQAAMAAJ&q=Sharon+Hennagin+Goldsmith&dq=Sharon+Hennagin+Goldsmith&hl=en&redir_esc=y]</ref> He was the main composer for the TV series ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'', although the main titles were written by [[David Arnold]] (who composed the score to ''[[Stargate (film)|Stargate]]'', the film that began the ''[[Stargate]]'' franchise). On ''[[Stargate Atlantis]]'' he composed the main titles and the score. During his career, he usually collaborated with two composers; his father [[Jerry Goldsmith]], and [[Neal Acree]]. He made his first move into video games music in 2006, scoring ''[[Call of Duty 3]]''. During his final years, Goldsmith relocated to Hidden Hills, California, where he built a superior home studio in his backlot. Goldsmith died of cancer on April 29, 2012, aged 54, at his home in Hidden Hills, California.<ref name="Obit" /> ==Emmy Award nominations== *Outstanding Music Composition for a Series (Dramatic Underscore) – ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' (1998) *[[Outstanding Main Title Theme Music]] – ''[[Stargate Atlantis]]'' (2005) *Outstanding Music Composition for a Series (Original Dramatic Score) – ''Stargate Atlantis'' (2006) ==Professional work== Goldsmith's repertoire includes: *''Echoes'' (2012 Will Waring un-aired pilot; final known score) *''[[War of the Dead]]'' (2012) *''[[Call of Duty 3]]'' (Video game) *''[[Diamonds (1999 film)|Diamonds]]'' *''[[Helen of Troy (TV miniseries)|Helen of Troy]]'' (TV miniseries) *''[[Joshua Tree (1993 film)|Joshua Tree]] *''[[Kull the Conqueror]]'' *''[[Laserblast]]'' *''[[Man's Best Friend (1993 film)|Man's Best Friend]]'' *''[[Moon 44]]'' *''[[A Woman, Her Men, and Her Futon]]'' *''Brotherhood of the Gun'' *''[[Ricky 1]]'' *''[[Sanctuary (TV series)|Sanctuary]]'' *''[[Stargate Atlantis]]'' *''[[Stargate SG-1]]'' *''[[Stargate Universe]]'' *''[[Stargate: Continuum]]'' *''[[Stargate: The Ark of Truth]]'' *''[[Star Trek: First Contact]]'' (on which he collaborated with his father) *''[[The Man With Two Brains]]'' *''[[The Rift (1989 film)|The Rift]]'' (Film, also known as ''La Grieta'') *''[[Witchblade (TV series)|Witchblade]]'' ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.freeclyde.com FreeClyde – The Official Website of Joel Goldsmith] *{{IMDb name|6107}} *{{Memoryalpha}} *[http://www.captphilonline.com/Destinies/Destinies_08_31_12.mp3 Joel Goldsmith Memorial on Destinies-The Voice of Science Fiction] {{Authority control|VIAF=74049288}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Goldsmith, Joel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American film score composer | DATE OF BIRTH = November 19, 1957 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Los Angeles, California | DATE OF DEATH = April 29, 2012 | PLACE OF DEATH = Hidden Hills, California }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goldsmith, Joel}} [[Category:1957 births]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:American film score composers]] [[Category:Cancer deaths in California]] {{US-composer-20thC-stub}}
